source_title: The 8 AI Skills That Will Separate Winners From Losers in 2026

insights.insight: SkepticismTrap: Believing what you hear. This often fuels “Shiny Object Syndrome” where you try every new tool or business model you just heard on Instagram. Jumping ship from vibe coding to automatio
insights.action: Use this approach in your work
insights.rationale: Extracted from sabrina-ramonov article on The 8 AI Skills That Will Separate Winners From Lo

insights.insight: Learn to Love LearningTrap: Stressed and afraid to learn new things, so when new AI tools come out you feel overwhelmed and resist learning. Putting too much pressure on yourself over making money rig
insights.action: Apply this approach in your work
insights.rationale: Extracted from sabrina-ramonov article on The 8 AI Skills That Will Separate Winners From Lo

insights.insight: Learn in PublicTrap: Avoiding posting content because you’re waiting until you’ve mastered an AI tool/skill, or finished building. Skill: Share your learnings, wins, and failures online transparently.
insights.action: Implement this approach in your work
insights.rationale: Extracted from sabrina-ramonov article on The 8 AI Skills That Will Separate Winners From Lo

insights.insight: Context EngineeringConcept: The more high-quality information and context about your situation, goals, what you’ve tried, what didn’t work, data, etc. you give AI, the higher-quality answers you get.
insights.action: Try this approach in your work
insights.rationale: Extracted from sabrina-ramonov article on The 8 AI Skills That Will Separate Winners From Lo

insights.insight: Sparring PartnersConcept: Stop using AI for surface-level answers. Use AI to understand what questions you should’ve been asking.Action: Tell AI to act as a critic or skeptic. For example, instead of
insights.action: Explore this approach in your work
